metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35992 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: An integer overflow vulnerability exists in the FST fstReaderIterBlocks2vesc allocation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115, when compiled as a 32-bitbinary. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to memory corruption. Avictim would need to open a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
